system.biography:
TitleFFF 508-1 Knight Patrician HH
Birthday18 Navek 691
AppearanceAge 28, height 5’10”, heavy frame, weight 192 lb, average appearance, dark complexion, black hair, hazel eyes.
Medical/PsycheNone
Size7
ArmorGood-quality quilt cowl, gambeson, and leggings; leather belt, gauntlets, and calf boots; scale hauberk; mail cowl; plate half-helm, ailettes, vambraces, and thigh guards; bastard sword, dagger, and round shield. Add lance and hand axe if he is mounted.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box
Valuables130d in coin, gold Ilvirian holy symbol (323d).
Notes

Biography

Sir Letos is a member of an old patrician clan in the Thardic Republic. His family owns several estates in the Firis district on the republic’s eastern edge. The youngest of three sons, Sir Letos doesn’t have much to do on the family estates, therefore he has become a freelance ivashu hunter. He travels with four to six legionnaires, riding from estate to estate asking if they have had any problems with ivashu. If so, he hires a dozen beaters and a local scout to guide him and goes after the problem creature. When the guide gets them close, Sir Letos and his men dismount and prepare a trap. Finally, the beaters drive the ivashu towards the trap. Letos tries to trap the creature alive if possible; killing it only if absolutely necessary.

Most of the captured ivashu are sold for use in the Pamesani arenas. Although he is a devotee of Ilvir, Sir Letos sees no problem with sending the creatures to their death. He is protecting estates and educating the city folk about the glory of Ilvir. Sir Letos has had custom armor made to glorify Ilvir’s creations.

Fighting the same creatures year in and year out has gotten boring for Sir Letos and he occasionally travels outside of Tharda. He has visited as far as Aleath, Cherafir, Golotha, and Geldeheim in search of new and interesting ivashu to hunt. He also occasionally participates in jousts against human opponents. Although his heavy armor slows him down and can make him an easy target on the ground, on horseback, Letos is like a centaur, one with his horse. He rides a powerful brown stallion named Moody, with whom he has an almost telepathic connection.

Adventure Hooks

Heard of Any Ivashu? At dinner, the PCs are introduced to a mountain of a man with a Thardic accent. He introduces himself as “Letos, Ivashu Hunter.” He is boisterous but lots of fun to be around. He invites the PC to join him on his next hunt.

It’s Mine. The PCs are attacked by an ivashu in the woods. They defend themselves and kill the beast. Just as they are laying the last blow, Sir Letos bursts out of the woods on his charger. “You have stolen my kill you ignorant fools!” He demands satisfaction, either the value of the ivashu or combat.

Extra Muscle. Ivashu hunting has been slow and Sir Letos is running short on funds. He lets it be known that there is a knight looking for respectable work. He is most interested in short-term employment or something that takes him back towards Tharda.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
